title: A Question
body:
Just a question as to how things work, how come Viktor had 2 skins, (which isn't many at all) a 3rd is added and then very soon after, one of the original 2 is taken away, leaving him with still only 2. Yet Teemo, Veigar and Yi are 3 champs that have loads and loads of skins and all 3 get legendary skins.
now im not complaining at all, i love those 3 skins (hate teemo and yi the champs but love the skins) I'm just curious

how come you remove skins from champs that have very few and add skins to champs that have heaps?

replies.body:
teemo, yi, and veigar are older champions.
obviously most older champions are going to have more skins than newer champions.
more popular champs are also going to have more skins.
and they're not removing the skins, they're putting them in the legacy vault because they're not to the current standard of skins.

There are multiple reasons why.
Usually skins come out as a set
e.g the current "Arcade" set or the "championship" set along with the Pool Party set and the upcoming "Project" skin set
While there are champions with few skins, when Riot wants to release a Skin set the champion must fit the.. "theme"? of the skin set along with other factors.

Then again this is just perspective and talking about skins that come out as a set.
this probably didn't help answer your question but hey, Funfacts with Ravenn 101~
